intro: Homalium palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
